subject: Programming
title: The Software Crisis
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Software Crisis.

hook.text: By the late 1960s, software projects kept failing. Budgets exploded and deadlines vanished.

buildup.text: Hardware improved every year, but software couldn't keep up with growing complexity.

discovery.text: NATO coined 'software crisis' in 1968, declaring the field needed engineering discipline.

twist.text: The crisis never fully ended. Decades later, most large software projects still run over budget.

climax.text: But the crisis sparked a new field: software engineering, built to tame complexity.

punchline.text: The crisis that never ended built a profession.

quiz.question: When was the term 'software crisis' coined?
